title: MUSIC MUSICOL 444-0-20 Seminar in Music and Film

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This seminar will be devoted to a survey of major scholarly literature on music and cinema from a variety of perspectives (originating from musicology, film studies, and other disciplines). Topics will include music and narrative (beginning from Claudia Gorbman's foundational Unheard Melodies); genre; hermeneutics; authorship and auteurism; sound technology; industry practices and media convergence, among others. Our goal is to absorb and reflect upon a variety of methodological approaches to this area of study, and our fundamental guiding questions will be: "How, as musicologists, can we study film?" and/or "How, as film scholars, can we study music?" Weekly reading will generally include either a complete scholarly monograph or several articles and chapters on a related topic, and students will be expected to develop and pursue a research project in which the methodologies examined can be put into practice.
